verses.text: If there be a \w controversy|strong="H7379"\w* between \w men|strong="H0582"\w*, and they \w come|strong="H5066"\w* unto \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w*, that \add the judges\add* may \w judge|strong="H8199"\w* them; then they shall \w justify|strong="H6663"\w* the \w righteous|strong="H6662"\w*, and \w condemn|strong="H7561"\w* the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w*.

And it shall be, if the wicked \w man|strong="H7563"\w* \add be\add* \w worthy|strong="H1121"\w* to be \w beaten|strong="H5221"\w*, that the \w judge|strong="H8199"\w* shall cause him to lie \w down|strong="H5307"\w*, and to be \w beaten|strong="H5221"\w* before his \w face|strong="H6440"\w*, \w according|strong="H1767"\w* to his \w fault|strong="H7564"\w*, by a certain \w number|strong="H4557"\w*.

\w Forty|strong="H0705"\w* \w stripes|strong="H5221"\w* he may give him, \add and\add* not \w exceed|strong="H3254"\w*: lest, \add if\add* he should \w exceed|strong="H3254"\w*, and \w beat|strong="H5221"\w* him above these with \w many|strong="H7227"\w* \w stripes|strong="H4347"\w*, then thy \w brother|strong="H0251"\w* should seem \w vile|strong="H7034"\w* unto thee.
¶ Thou shalt not \w muzzle|strong="H2629"\w* the \w ox|strong="H7794"\w* when he treadeth \w out|strong="H1778"\w* \add the corn\add*.\f + \fr 25.4 \ft treadeth…: Heb. thresheth\f*

¶ If \w brethren|strong="H0251"\w* \w dwell|strong="H3427"\w* \w together|strong="H3162"\w*, and \w one|strong="H0259"\w* of them \w die|strong="H4191"\w*, and have no \w child|strong="H1121"\w*, the \w wife|strong="H0802"\w* of the \w dead|strong="H4191"\w* shall not marry \w without|strong="H2351"\w* unto a \w stranger|strong="H0376"\w*: her \w husband’s brother|strong="H2993"\w* shall go \w in|strong="H0935"\w* unto her, and \w take|strong="H3947"\w* her to him to \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*, and perform the duty of an \w husband’s brother|strong="H2992"\w* unto her.\f + \fr 25.5 \ft her husband’s…: or, her next kinsman\f*

And it shall be, \add that\add* the \w firstborn|strong="H1060"\w* which she \w beareth|strong="H3205"\w* shall \w succeed|strong="H6965"\w* in the \w name|strong="H8034"\w* of his \w brother|strong="H0251"\w* \add which is\add* \w dead|strong="H4191"\w*, that his \w name|strong="H8034"\w* be not put \w out|strong="H4229"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*.

And if the \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w like|strong="H2654"\w* not to \w take|strong="H3947"\w* his \w brother’s wife|strong="H2994"\w*, then let his \w brother’s wife|strong="H2994"\w* go \w up|strong="H5927"\w* to the \w gate|strong="H8179"\w* unto the \w elders|strong="H2205"\w*, and \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, My \w husband’s brother|strong="H2993"\w* \w refuseth|strong="H3985"\w* to raise \w up|strong="H6965"\w* unto his \w brother|strong="H0251"\w* a \w name|strong="H8034"\w* in \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, he \w will|strong="H0014"\w* not perform the duty of my \w husband’s brother|strong="H2992"\w*.\f + \fr 25.7 \ft brother’s: or, next kinsman’s\f*

Then the \w elders|strong="H2205"\w* of his \w city|strong="H5892"\w* shall \w call|strong="H7121"\w* him, and \w speak|strong="H1696"\w* unto him: and \add if\add* he \w stand|strong="H5975"\w* \add to it\add*, and \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, I \w like|strong="H2654"\w* not to \w take|strong="H3947"\w* her;

Then shall his \w brother’s wife|strong="H2994"\w* \w come|strong="H5066"\w* unto him in the \w presence|strong="H5869"\w* of the \w elders|strong="H2205"\w*, and \w loose|strong="H2502"\w* his \w shoe|strong="H5275"\w* from off his \w foot|strong="H7272"\w*, and \w spit|strong="H3417"\w* in his \w face|strong="H6440"\w*, and shall \w answer|strong="H6030"\w* and \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, So shall it be \w done|strong="H6213"\w* unto that \w man|strong="H0376"\w* that will not build \w up|strong="H1129"\w* his \w brother’s|strong="H0251"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*.

And his \w name|strong="H8034"\w* shall be \w called|strong="H7121"\w* in \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, The \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of him that hath his \w shoe|strong="H5275"\w* \w loosed|strong="H2502"\w*.

¶ When \w men|strong="H0582"\w* \w strive|strong="H5327"\w* \w together|strong="H3162"\w* one with \w another|strong="H0251"\w*, and the \w wife|strong="H0802"\w* of the \w one|strong="H0259"\w* draweth \w near|strong="H7126"\w* for to \w deliver|strong="H5337"\w* her \w husband|strong="H0376"\w* out of the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of him that \w smiteth|strong="H5221"\w* him, and putteth \w forth|strong="H7971"\w* her \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*, and \w taketh|strong="H2388"\w* him by the \w secrets|strong="H4016"\w*:
Then thou shalt cut \w off|strong="H7112"\w* her \w hand|strong="H3709"\w*, thine \w eye|strong="H5869"\w* shall not \w pity|strong="H2347"\w* \add her\add*.

¶ Thou shalt not have in thy \w bag|strong="H3599"\w* divers \w weights|strong="H0068"\w*, a \w great|strong="H1419"\w* and a \w small|strong="H6996"\w*.\f + \fr 25.13 \ft divers…: Heb. a stone and a stone\f*

Thou shalt not have in thine \w house|strong="H1004"\w* divers \w measures|strong="H0374"\w*, a \w great|strong="H1419"\w* and a \w small|strong="H6996"\w*.\f + \fr 25.14 \ft divers…: Heb. an ephah and an ephah\f*

\add But\add* thou shalt have a \w perfect|strong="H8003"\w* and \w just|strong="H6664"\w* \w weight|strong="H0068"\w*, a \w perfect|strong="H8003"\w* and \w just|strong="H6664"\w* \w measure|strong="H0374"\w* shalt thou have: that thy \w days|strong="H3117"\w* may be \w lengthened|strong="H0748"\w* in the \w land|strong="H0127"\w* which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w giveth|strong="H5414"\w* thee.

For all that \w do|strong="H6213"\w* such \w things|strong="H0428"\w*, \add and\add* all that \w do|strong="H6213"\w* \w unrighteously|strong="H5766"\w*, \add are\add* an \w abomination|strong="H8441"\w* unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w*.

¶ \w Remember|strong="H2142"\w* what \w Amalek|strong="H6002"\w* \w did|strong="H6213"\w* unto thee by the \w way|strong="H1870"\w*, when ye were come \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* out of \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w*;

How he \w met|strong="H7136"\w* thee by the \w way|strong="H1870"\w*, and smote the \w hindmost|strong="H2179"\w* of thee, \add even\add* all \add that were\add* \w feeble|strong="H2826"\w* \w behind|strong="H0310"\w* thee, when thou \add wast\add* \w faint|strong="H5889"\w* and \w weary|strong="H3023"\w*; and he \w feared|strong="H3373"\w* not \w God|strong="H0430"\w*.
